46082.「ここは 採掘作業員の簡易宿舎よ。\n たいした おもてなしは できないけれど\:
This is a simple place for miners... I can't offer much in the way of hospitality, but I can restore your HP and MP by resting at the
inn... You're alone and you have <%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> gold. Do you want to rest?

46083.「おはよう。\n 疲れは取れたかな？\n<br>\n「あ そうそう！\n はじめ:
Oh... I hope you're not too tired. Oh, yes! If you're resting for the first time, there's one important thing you should know... We
innkeepers sometimes hear of the fame of those who have rested. Fame is an indication of how well a person is known to the world as
an adventurer. Whether it's fulfilling quests from people in need, working tirelessly as a craftsman, or slaying neglected demons... If
you've achieved a certain level of fame through your actions for the good of the world, rest at the inn and I'll let you know
your level of fame, just remember...

46084.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ！\n 冒険で ＨＰやＭＰが へってきましたら\n 宿屋:
Welcome to the Traveler's Inn! If your HP and MP are low from your adventures, you can recover them by resting at the inn... You are
now worth <%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> gold.

46085.「おはようございます。\n よく お休みでしたね。\n<br>\n「あ そうそう:
Good morning... Have a good night. Oh, yes! I have something important to say to our first guest... We, the innkeepers, often hear the
voices of travelers who have taken a day off... Fame is a measure of how well a person is known to the world as an adventurer. I've
completed quests for people in need, I've worked tirelessly as a craftsman, I've slayed abandoned demons... Once you've achieved a
certain level of fame by working for the good of the world and the good of others, you can rest at the inn and we'll tell you your level
of fame...

46086.「いらっしゃい。ここは 旅人の宿屋。\n 冒険で ＨＰやＭＰが へってきたら\n:
Welcome to... This is a traveler... When your HP and MP are low, you can rest at the inn... You're alone and you have <%dL_YADOYA_GOLD>
gold.

46087.「おや お目覚めかい。\n よく休めたようだね。\n<br>\n「あ そうそう！:
Oh, wake up... I'm well-rested... Oh, yes! Let me tell you something important about the first traveler who took a day off... We
innkeepers sometimes hear the voices of travelers who have taken a day off... Fame is a way of saying how well known and respected
an adventurer is. Whether it's fulfilling quests from people in need, working tirelessly as a craftsman, or slaying
neglected demons... Once you've achieved a certain level of fame through your work for the world and for others, you can rest at the
inn and we'll tell you your level of fame...

46088.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n 冒険で ＨＰやＭＰが へってきた時は\n 宿屋で:
To the Traveler's Inn... If you're running low on HP or MP during your adventures, you can recover by resting at the inn...
<%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> You're about to turn gold, do you want to rest?

46089.「おはようございます。\n よく お休みでしたね。\n<br>\n「あ そうそう:
Good morning... Have a good night. Oh, yes! If you're a traveler who's taken a day off for the first time, there's something
important you should know... We, the innkeepers, are sometimes asked for the names of travelers who have taken a day off... Fame
is a measure of how well a person is known to the world as an adventurer. You complete quests for people in need, you work hard at
your craft, you slay neglected demons... Once you've achieved a certain level of fame by working for the good of the world and the
good of others, you can rest at the inn and we'll tell you your level of fame...

46090.「いらっしゃい。ここは 旅人の宿。\n 冒険で ＨＰやＭＰが へってきたら\n:
Welcome to... This is a travel... If you're low on HP or MP during your adventure, you can rest at the inn... One of you has
<%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> gold, will you take a rest?

46091.「おはよ。\n ゆっくり休めた？\n<br>\n「あ そうそう！\n はじめて:
... Did you get some rest? Oh, yes! I need to tell you something important about our first resting traveler... We innkeepers often hear
the names of travelers who have taken a break. Fame is an indication of how well a person is known to the world as an
adventurer. Whether it's fulfilling quests from people in need, working as a craftsman, or slaying abandoned demons... Once you've
achieved a certain level of fame, you can rest at the inn, and the innkeeper will tell you your level of fame...

120353.「ここは 不思議の宿屋だ。\n <%nL_YADOYA_GOLD>ゴールドに な:
This is the Mysterious Tower's inn. Would you
like to take a rest? It'll be <%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> Gold.
<yesno><break>

120354.「ここは 不思議の宿屋だ。\n 今日は 旅の仲間が 一緒のようだな。\n<br>:
This place is a wonder... You're staying with a fellow traveler today... I can't stay with any other travelers, so I'll be alone with my
gold.

120355.「ここは 不思議の宿屋だ。\n 今日は 酒場で紹介してもらった仲間が\n 一緒の:
This place is a wonder... I'm with a group of people I was introduced to at the bar... All of us together will be worth
<%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> gold. Shall we rest?

120356.「ここは 不思議の宿屋だ。\n 今日は いろいろな 旅の仲間が\n 一緒のようだ:
This place is a wonder... There are many travelers with us today... If you add up all the companions you were introduced to at the
tavern, you'll be worth <%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> gold.

120357.「ここは 不思議の宿屋だ。\n 冒険で ＨＰやＭＰが 減ってきたら\n 宿屋で休:
This is the place of wonder... If you're running low on HP or MP during your adventure, you can rest at the inn and
recover... One of us is worth <%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> gold.

120358.「おはよう。\n よく 休むことはできたか？\n<br>\n「……そういえば\n:
Good morning. Did you rest well?
By the way, if this is your first time staying here, there's something important you should know.
Us innkeepers often overhear the exploits of guests that rest at our inns.
These exploits, known as fame, indicate how well you are known amongst other adventurers.
Completing quests for those in need, working tirelessly as a craftsman, defeating monsters that no one else will take care of...
If you've reached a certain level of fame when resting at an inn, we will let you know what is it once you awake.

120359.「おはよう。\n よく 休むことはできたか。\n<br>\n「おっと そうだ。ウ:
Good morning. Did you have a good rest?
Oh, that's right. I've heard all about you from the other guests who stay here. Seems like you're making a name for yourself.

120361.「おはよう。\n よく 休むことはできたか？\n じゃあ がんばってこいよ。<t:
Good morning. Did you rest well?
Good luck with your travels.<turn_end>

increasing your fame by <%dL_MEISEI1>!
<end>

120368.立て札への書き込みが みんなの役に立って\n<pc>は <%dL_MEISEI2:
Your postings have been quite helpful!
<pc> received <%dL_MEISEI2> Fame Points!
<end>

120375.「たいした事は してやれないが\n ゆっくり 休んでいってくれ。:
This is all I can do for you. I hope you have
a good rest.

120376.「たいした事は してやれないが\n ゆっくり 休んでいってくれ。:
This is all I can do for you. I hope you have
a good rest.

120378.「こんにちは。\n 旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n<br>\n「お泊まりですか？\:
Hello and welcome to our inn.
Would you like to stay overnight or rest until night? It'll be <%dL_YADOYA_GOLD> Gold.

120379.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n こんな夜ふけまで お疲れさまでした。\n<br>:
Traveler's lodge. Hello. Thank you for
staying until this late at night. <Would you
like to stay for the night?<yesno><break>

270322.「これはこれは 大魔王様。\n あなた様からは お代はいただけません。\n ぜひ:
If it isn't the Demon Lord!
Of course for you, there is no charge.
Would you like to take a rest here?
<yesno><break>

270323.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ！\n 冒険で ＨＰやＭＰが へってきましたら\n 宿屋:
Welcome to the Traveler's Inn! If you've lost HP or MP during your adventures, you can recover them by resting at the inn... The
Great Demon Lord doesn't pay for this... Would you like to rest?

270324.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n 今日は 酒場で紹介してもらった仲間が\n ご一緒:
Traveler's lodge. Hello. I'm with a friend of mine who was introduced to me at the tavern. The Great Demon Lord doesn't pay me... Please
have a good night's rest...

270325.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n 今日は 旅のお仲間が\n いらっしゃるようですね:
Traveler's lodge. Hello. It seems we have company for the day... The Great Demon Lord will pay for your stay. I'm afraid I can't
stay with the other travelers. Would you like to rest?

270326.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n 今日は 大勢の 旅のお仲間が\n ご一緒のようで:
Traveler's lodge. Hello. It seems there are many travelers with us today... I'm sure there's plenty more where that came from...
Would you like to rest?

270327.「大魔王様のために\n ふかふかの布団を ご用意いたしました。\n どうぞ ごゆ:
We've prepared a soft bed for you, Demon Lord.
Please have a good night's rest.

270328.「皆さまのために\n ふかふかの布団を ご用意いたしました。\n どうぞ ごゆっ:
We've prepared soft beds for you all. Please
have a good night's sleep.

270329.「残念ですが\n お金が 足りないようです。<bw_break>: I'm sorry, but you don't have enough money.<bw_break>

270330.「わかりました 大魔王様。\n また いつでもお立ち寄りください。<turn_e:
Understood, milord.
Please stop by anytime you wish.
<turn_end>

270331.「おはようございます。\n よく お休みでしたね。\n では いってらっしゃいま:
Good morning. I hope you had a good rest.
Good luck on your journey.<turn_end>

270332.「おはようございます。\n よく お休みでしたね。\n<br>\n「あ そうそう:
Good morning... Have a good night. Oh, yes! I have something important to say to our first guest... We, the innkeepers, often hear the
voices of travelers who have taken a day off... Fame is a measure of how well a person is known to the world as an adventurer. I've
completed quests for people in need, I've worked tirelessly as a craftsman, I've slayed abandoned demons... Once you've achieved a
certain level of fame by working for the good of the world and the good of others, you can rest at the inn and we'll tell you your level
of fame...

270333.「おはようございます。\n よく お休みでしたね。\n<br>\n「おっと そう:
Good morning. I hope you rested well.
Oh, that's right! I've heard a lot about you from our other guests. I'd expect no less from the Demon Lord!

270341.「こんにちは。\n 旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n<br>\n「お泊まりですか？\:
Hello... Traveler's lodge. Hello... Are you staying the night? Or would you like to rest for the night? Of course, you'll be charged
for both...

270342.「旅人の宿屋へ ようこそ。\n こんな夜ふけまで お疲れさまでした。\n<br>:
Traveler's lodge. Hello. Thank you for
staying up so late. I'm afraid you'll have to
pay. Would you like to stay the night?<yesno><break>
